t: Mark 14
Death Plot and Anointing
Now*p the Passover and Unleavened Bread were two days away; and the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to seize Him by stealth and kill Him;*i
for they were saying, “Not during the festival, otherwise there might be a riot of the people.”

While*p He was in Bethany at the home of Simon the leper, and reclining at*i the*i table,*i there came a woman with an alabaster vial of very costly perfume of pure nard; and*i she broke the vial and poured it over His head.
But some were indignantly remarking*i to one another, “Why has this perfume been wasted?
For this perfume might have been sold for over three hundred denarii, and the*i money*i given to the poor.” And they were scolding her.
But Jesus said, “Let*r her*r alone;*r why*r do*r you*r bother*r her?*r She*r has*r done*r a*r good*r deed*r to*r Me.*r
For*r you*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you,*r and*r whenever*r you*r wish*r you*r can*r do*r good*r to*r them;*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r Me.*r
She*r has*r done*r what*r she*r could;*r she*r has*r anointed*r My*r body*r beforehand*r for*r the*r burial.*r
Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r wherever*r the*r gospel*r is*r preached*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r this*r woman*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r spoken*r of*r in*r memory*r of*r her.”*r
Then*p Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went off to the chief priests in order to betray Him to them.
They were glad when they heard this,*i and promised to give him money. And he began*i seeking how to betray Him at an opportune time.
The Last Passover
On*p the first day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb*i was being sacrificed, His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to go and prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
And He sent two of His disciples and said to them, “Go*r into*r the*r city,*r and*r a*r man*r will*r meet*r you*r carrying*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water;*r follow*r him;*r

and*r wherever*r he*r enters,*r say*r to*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r house,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says,*r “Where*r is*r My*r guest*r room*r in*r which*r I*r may*r eat*r the*r Passover*r with*r My*r disciples?” ’*r
And*r he*r himself*r will*r show*r you*r a*r large*r upper*r room*r furnished*r and*ir ready;*r prepare*r for*r us*r there.”*r
The disciples went out and came to the city, and found it*i just as He had told them; and they prepared the Passover.
When*p it was evening He came with the twelve.
As they were reclining at*i the*i table*i and eating, Jesus said, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r Me—one*r who*r is*r eating*r with*r Me.”*r
They began to be grieved and to say to Him one by one, “Surely not I?”
And He said to them, “It*ir is*ir one*r of*r the*r twelve,*r one*r who*r dips*r with*r Me*r in*r the*r bowl.*r

For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*ir to*ir go*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r Him;*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*ir would*ir have*ir been*ir good*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.”*r
The Lord’s Supper
While*p they were eating, He took some*i bread, and after a blessing He broke it,*i and gave it*i to them, and said, “Take*r it;*ir this*r is*r My*r body.”*r
And when He had taken a cup and*i given thanks, He gave it*i to them, and they all drank from it.
And He said to them, “This*r is*r My*r blood*r of*r the*r covenant,*r which*r is*r poured*r out*r for*r many.*r
Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r never*r again*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
After*p singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
And*p Jesus said to them, “You*r will*r all*r fall*r away,*r because*r it*r is*r written,*r ‘I*r will*sr strike*sr down*sr the*sr shepherd,*sr and*sr the*sr sheep*sr shall*sr be*sr scattered.’*sr
But*r after*r I*r have*r been*r raised,*r I*r will*r go*r ahead*r of*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
But Peter said to Him, “Even*i though all may fall away, yet I will not.”
And Jesus said to him, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r that*r this*r very*r night,*r before*r a*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r yourself*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
But Peter*i kept saying insistently, “Even*i if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And they all were saying the same thing also.
Jesus in Gethsemane
They*p came to a place named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, “Sit*r here*r until*r I*r have*r prayed.”*r
And He took with Him Peter and James and John, and began to be very distressed and troubled.
And He said to them, “My*r soul*r is*r deeply*r grieved*r to*r the*r point*r of*r death;*r remain*r here*r and*r keep*r watch.”*r
And He went a little beyond them,*i and fell to the ground and began*i to pray that if it were possible, the hour might pass Him by.
And He was saying, “Abba!*r Father!*r All*r things*r are*r possible*r for*r You;*r remove*r this*r cup*r from*r Me;*r yet*r not*r what*r I*r will,*r but*r what*r You*r will.”*r
And He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon,*r are*r you*r asleep?*r Could*r you*r not*r keep*r watch*r for*r one*r hour?*r
Keep*r watching*r and*r praying*r that*r you*r may*r not*r come*r into*r temptation;*r the*r spirit*r is*r willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.”*r
Again He went away and prayed, saying the same words.
And again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy; and they did not know what to answer Him.

And He came the third time, and said to them, “Are*r you*r still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r It*r is*r enough;*r the*r hour*r has*r come;*r behold,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r being*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Get*r up,*r let*r us*r be*r going;*r behold,*r the*r one*r who*r betrays*r Me*r is*r at*r hand!”*r
Betrayal and Arrest
Immediately*p while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came up accompanied by a crowd with swords and clubs, who*i were*i from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
Now he who was betraying Him had given them a signal, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the one; seize Him and lead Him away under guard.”
After coming, Judas immediately went to Him, saying, “Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
They laid hands on Him and seized Him.
But one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
And Jesus said to them, “Have*r you*r come*r out*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs*r to*r arrest*r Me,*r as*r you*ir would*ir against*r a*r robber?*r
Every*r day*r I*r was*r with*r you*r in*r the*r temple*r teaching,*r and*r you*r did*r not*r seize*r Me;*r but*r this*ir has*ir taken*ir place*ir to*r fulfill*r the*r Scriptures.”*r
And they all left Him and fled.
A*p young man was following Him, wearing nothing*i but*i a linen sheet over his*i naked body;*i and they seized him.
But he pulled free of the linen sheet and escaped naked.
Jesus before His Accusers
They*p led Jesus away to the high priest; and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes gathered together.
Peter had followed Him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest; and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire.
Now the chief priests and the whole Council kept trying to obtain testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, and they were not finding any.
For many were giving false testimony against Him, but their testimony was not consistent.
Some stood up and began*i to give false testimony against Him, saying,
“We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’ ”
Not even in this respect was their testimony consistent.
The high priest stood up and*i came*i forward and questioned Jesus, saying, “Do You not answer? What is it that these men are testifying against You?”
But He kept silent and did not answer. Again the high priest was questioning Him, and saying to Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”*i
And Jesus said, “I*r am;*r and*r you*r shall*r see*r the*sr Son*sr of*sr Man*sr sitting*sr at*sr the*sr right*sr hand*sr of*sr Power,*sr and*r coming*sr with*sr the*sr clouds*sr of*sr heaven.”*sr
Tearing his clothes, the high priest said, “What further need do we have of witnesses?
You have heard the blasphemy; how does it seem to you?” And they all condemned Him to be deserving of death.
Some began to spit at Him, and to blindfold Him, and to beat Him with their fists, and to say to Him, “Prophesy!” And the officers received Him with slaps in*i the*i face.*i
Peter’s Denials
As*p Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant-girls of the high priest came,
and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Nazarene.”
But he denied it,*i saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are talking about.” And he went out onto the porch.
The servant-girl saw him, and began once more to say to the bystanders, “This is one*i of them!”
But again he denied it. And after a little while the bystanders were again saying to Peter, “Surely you are one*i of them, for you are a Galilean too.”
But he began to curse and swear, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”

Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. And Peter remembered how Jesus had made the remark to him, “Before*r a*r rooster*r crows*r twice,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r And he began to weep.
